title: Macroeconomic scoreboard
maintainer_displayname: ZBO | Centraal Bureau voor de Statistiek
name: macroeconomic-scoreboard
notes:
To identify in a timely manner existing and potential imbalances and possible macroeconomic risks within the countries of the European Union in an early stage, the European Commission has drawn up a scoreboard with eleven indicators. This scoreboard is part of the Macroeconomic Imbalance Procedure (MIP). This table contains quarterly and annual figures for these eleven indicators for the Netherlands.

Data available from: first quarter of 2006.

Status of the figures:
Annual and quarterly data are provisional.

Changes as of 9 January 2015:
Figures on the third quarter of 2014 have been added for all indicators except for the nominal unit labour costs. Furthermore, the figure on the second quarter of 2014 have been adjusted for the net international investment position and the current account balance. For the real effective exchange rate, figures have been adjusted slightly over the whole time series. Moreover, the figure on the private credit flow in the third quarter of 2013 was not correct. This figure has been adjusted as well.

When will new figures be published?
New data are published within 120 days after the end of each quarter. Quarterly data for the previous three quarters are adjusted along when the fourth quarter figures are published in April. This corresponds with the first estimate of the annual data for the previous year. The annual and quarterly data for the last three years are revised together with the publication of the first quarter in July.
